body: @Hgit007 Images in the Paris-Street-View dataset have their extension in the capital letter `.JPG` as opposed to a regular `.jpg` extension. Which poses a problem on Unix based systems. I just pushed a patch to the `flist.py` file that fixes the issue.

Dear Knazeri,
Thank you very much. I also find the extension problem and I have change the extension with the capital letter. Now I encounter two questions. 
The first one is that Paris-Street-View dataset only contains the training and evaluation images. How you split the dataset and obtain the test set. 
The second one is that when I run the train.py on Paris-Street-View dataset.
`python train.py --model 1 --checkpoints ./checkpoints/psv`
I encounter the loading error which is shown as follow.

@Hgit007 Looks like you have not provided the mask dataset! Please follow the instruction in the readme on how to download and use a mask dataset:
https://github.com/knazeri/edge-connect#2-irregular-masks

@knazeri 
Thanks for your instant response and kind reply. I will try it.

Dear Knazeri,
I am sorry I cannot well understand the using of irregular mask dataset. 
Q1:The images in mask dataset own the resolution 512x512. Because the resolution of image used in your work is 256x256 eventually. I wonder to know whether you do the down-sampling for the mask image. 
Q2ï¼šCould you give some instructions about how you use the mask dataset in your work. If you randomly select the mask images for every image in the training sets for places/celeba/psv. I cannot make sense of it. 
Thank you very much.

Best Wishes!

Dear Knazeri,
Thanks for your instant reply. 

Q1: What the dowsample/upsample algorithms is used in your work. Or I can use any algorithms to achieve this step. I find you use the bilinear interpolation to resize the RGB image in CelebA dataset in Section B of page 11 in your paper.

Q2: I cannot well understand the external mask dataset means. Whether it refers as the irregular mask datasets or artificial made mask dataset?

Thank you very much.

Best Wishes!

Dear Knazeri,
I have download the irregular mask database and I downsample the  image using the most simple code.
`img_downsample=img_origin(1:2:end,1:2:end)`
After do that, I generate the _mask_train.flist_ . I also generate the _places2_train.flist_ with the sub-category z.  But I still encounter the loading error. 

- Q3: How can I fix it?

- Q4: Whether the mask type can repeat? Or I can divide the mask into train/test/validation set randomly. How can I do it as your work?

- Q5: There just only 12000 mask  types. But the image in places2 is already 10 million+ images.  I would like to know whether I do the right  procedure.  Moreover, if the 12000 mask type is shared with three dataset.

- Q6: I think I need to generate the `places2_train.flist` which includes all images in every categories in places2 dataset. There are so many sub-folders.  How can I realize it?

![www](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39703828/56864411-82dd7900-69f4-11e9-84fa-5370e5dd9f8f.png)

I am so sorry to throw you so much questions once time, which include the last comment.

@Hgit007 
- Q1. Any interpolation scheme can be used here, it really depends on your preference. You can see/change the interpolation here:
https://github.com/knazeri/edge-connect/blob/27b7ce01a821605bb6b5e79998de5e94276b4908/src/dataset.py#L158

- Q2. The external mask dataset can be used for irregular masks. If you wish you can also use rectangular masks (which does not need any external mask dataset) by just setting `MASK: 1` in the config file.

- Q3. The error says it cannot load your mask files. You need to set `TRAIN_MASK_FLIST`, `VAL_MASK_FLIST`, and `TEST_MASK_FLIST` in the configuration file.

- Q4. We divided the mask dataset into train/test/validation before training. You can also separate them before training your model. How you separate them is arbitrary.

- Q5. The goal of inpainting is not to learn irregularity in the masks but to inpaint the missing region. The 12,000 random shaped masks dataset covers most of shapes and irregularities. At the same time, you can augment the dataset by rotation and reflection as explained in the paper and increase the size to 96,000 mask images. Sharing mask dataset between three separate models is irrelevant. Each model is trained from scratch and the samples are iid.

- Q6. The provided script `flist.py` takes care of that, as you see the script recursively visits every subfolder:
https://github.com/knazeri/edge-connect/blob/27b7ce01a821605bb6b5e79998de5e94276b4908/scripts/flist.py#L13-L17

Dear Knazeri,

It is very appreciate that you give the kind reply.

I have load the mask file correctly. But now, the training process is end up instantly, which likes the problem  some one has already encountered.
[https://github.com/knazeri/edge-connect/issues/54](url)
![qqqq](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39703828/56872664-3169d400-6a5e-11e9-8336-fba07649e659.png)

- The _.flist_ stores at `./dataset/places2`.  The file content is as follows.

- The  mask dataset stores at  `/home/allen/ZH/Database/places2/mask_places2`

- This is my configure file. Actually it is your default file. 
`MODE: 1             # 1: train, 2: test, 3: eval
MODEL: 1            # 1: edge model, 2: inpaint model, 3: edge-inpaint model, 4: joint model
MASK: 3             # 1: random block, 2: half, 3: external, 4: (external, random block), 5: (external, random block, half)
EDGE: 1             # 1: canny, 2: external
NMS: 1              # 0: no non-max-suppression, 1: applies non-max-suppression on the external edges by multiplying by Canny
SEED: 10            # random seed
GPU: [0]            # list of gpu ids
DEBUG: 0            # turns on debugging mode
VERBOSE: 0          # turns on verbose mode in the output console

TRAIN_FLIST: ./datasets/places2_train.flist
VAL_FLIST: ./datasets/places2_val.flist
TEST_FLIST: ./datasets/places2_test.flist

TRAIN_EDGE_FLIST: ./datasets/places2_edges_train.flist
VAL_EDGE_FLIST: ./datasets/places2_edges_val.flist
TEST_EDGE_FLIST: ./datasets/places2_edges_test.flist

TRAIN_MASK_FLIST: ./datasets/masks_train.flist
VAL_MASK_FLIST: ./datasets/masks_val.flist
TEST_MASK_FLIST: ./datasets/masks_test.flist

LR: 0.0001                    # learning rate
D2G_LR: 0.1                   # discriminator/generator learning rate ratio
BETA1: 0.0                    # adam optimizer beta1
BETA2: 0.9                    # adam optimizer beta2
BATCH_SIZE: 8                 # input batch size for training
INPUT_SIZE: 256               # input image size for training 0 for original size
SIGMA: 2                      # standard deviation of the Gaussian filter used in Canny edge detector (0: random, -1: no edge)
MAX_ITERS: 2e6                # maximum number of iterations to train the model

EDGE_THRESHOLD: 0.5           # edge detection threshold
L1_LOSS_WEIGHT: 1             # l1 loss weight
FM_LOSS_WEIGHT: 10            # feature-matching loss weight
STYLE_LOSS_WEIGHT: 250        # style loss weight
CONTENT_LOSS_WEIGHT: 0.1      # perceptual loss weight
INPAINT_ADV_LOSS_WEIGHT: 0.1  # adversarial loss weight

GAN_LOSS: nsgan               # nsgan | lsgan | hinge
GAN_POOL_SIZE: 0              # fake images pool size

SAVE_INTERVAL: 1000           # how many iterations to wait before saving model (0: never)
SAMPLE_INTERVAL: 1000         # how many iterations to wait before sampling (0: never)
SAMPLE_SIZE: 12               # number of images to sample
EVAL_INTERVAL: 0              # how many iterations to wait before model evaluation (0: never)
LOG_INTERVAL: 10              # how many iterations to wait before logging training status (0: never)`

Thank you very much.
Best Wishes!

@Hgit007 The issue #54 is different in that they could train the model yet it stopped after reaching 1000 iterations. Yours doesn't even start. Normally that happens when your `.flist` file path is invalid, the file is empty, or contains wrong image paths.
I noticed that you said your `.flist` file is stored at `./dataset/places2` path, yet in your configuration, you are using ` ./datasets/places2_edges_train.flist`. Does it have to be ` ./datasets/places2/places2_edges_train.flist`?

Dear Knazeri,
I have trained the model with partial images on places2 databset from Apr 30. But it still runs. I am not sure whether it it right. And I want to know how long you training the models in every datasets.


Thank you very much.

@Hgit007 It really depends on the dataset. Places2 dataset is huge and training on a subset of the dataset is not a good practice because you might lose some of the variability in data. We trained the model on full Places2 dataset (8M+ images) for weeks. We encourage everyone to use the pre-train weights to bootstrap their models.
